<OLD>

> 
> Yes, the dreaded MAGMATRON, there were many whispering of who =
and what
> he was. he was once a decorated Warrior-General who rose up with=
in the
> ranks of the Predacons, powerful and intelligent he was a military=
 and
> tactical genius. He disappeared almost a century ago. Some thought h=
e
> had been defeated in some battle, perhaps assasinated by an up and
> co=
mming Predacon. But yet here he was finally resurfacing after five
> decade=
s here on old Earth.
> 

<NEW>

WHEELIE's files upon MAGMATRON were very li=
mited, almost entirely to gossip.  Along with MAGMATRON and the legendary P=
redacon General GALVATRON, few other could have ever given as many skipped =
beats to Maximal Fuel Pumps.  Both had been, according to what little infor=
mation WHEELIE had ever heard, listing as missing, dead, or exterminated.  =
But if MAGMATRON had shown himself here, then what of the otehr?

OOC - Not=
 sure if the Beast Wars II character GALVATRON has shown up here, but it se=
emed appropriate to reference him in the same thought bubble as MAGMATRON. =
 Otherwise, either way it can be WHEELIE just being vastly unfamiliar with =
both and going by gossip, and not having personal experience with eitehr - =
they could have both been dead millenia for all he knew. ;)



<OLD - UNUS>=


> 
> There was a nod from UNUS, "It is not your fault." he said solemly.
=
> "But that which does not terminate us only gives us strength." There
> wa=
s a quiet dignity in him as he moved. For some reason, even though
> he was=
 the same body design and structure as the rest he was larger
> and robust,=
 his armor a bit thicker from the look of it. His movements
> were one of a=
 soldier, long used to the art of war, much like the
> others who walked wi=
th them.
> 
> "We have not learned much from your friend." FIREHORN said as=
 they
> walked, his words more gruff and clipped. "But he seemed to be be m=
ade
> of sturdy material. "He came in heavilly wounded and yet he was still=

> able to talk, even if just a little."
> 
> ASTRA nodded, "It was Firehor=
n who found him." She said. "We brought him here."
> 
> They stopped at a d=
oor with medical syumbology recognizable on it. At
> UNUS' gesture the door=
 slid open.
> 
> Inside was a very spartan room. The walls were plain and u=
litarian,
> painted a single offwhite color. There was a small console on o=
ne side
> presumably for the medical staff to use. There was a small viewsc=
reen,
> a single recharging chamber and medical bed.
> 
> However on the be=
d was a single figure, his optics dull but definitely
> online as he focuse=
d on WHEELIE. "I thought it would be Tuscon coming
> for me." he said grogg=
illy as if he had just come out of a long sleep.
> "But I am glad it is you=
." His voice clearing as he spoke.
> 
> He sat up on the medbed, painted in=
 oranges, reds and golds he was the
> picture of leadership and yet even wh=
en recovering there was still a
> power within him, an energy or fire that =
could not wholly quenched.
> 
> It was RODIMUS PRIME.

<NEW - WHEELIE>

At =
this point, there was a confused..  Blink from WHEELIE.  Speaking quietly, =
"What is this, what have we here?  How have you come to be without cheer?"
=

Glancing over RODIMUS, his old friend seemingly aged for the damage he had=
 taken like KUP to WHEELIE's sensors, body seeming partially faded, even th=
ough the glow was still omnipresent.

"What has happened here, and what is =
going on?  You looked like you were at the bottom fo the foot, stomped on b=
y Trypticon."

Pausing and then continuing, "Now, I am gald you are here, b=
ut a few things we have to know..  Something very wrong is in this area, an=
d out of it we will have to go.  We cannot speak, we cannot sense, we canno=
t call afar.  It is as if we are cut off from existence here, like webbed u=
p in a separate jar."
